answers.answer:
National Curative Health Programs (PNSC) are a set of measures run by the National Health Insurance House, designed to ensure specific treatment for diseases with a major impact on public health, with an emphasis on treatment. They provide access to medicine, sanitary materials, medical devices, and specific services and investigations for eligible patients.

To find detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read under the section titled "National Curative Health Programs."

To find detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read under the section titled "National Curative Health Programs." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs

The National Health Insurance House is responsible for managing National Curative Health Programs.

You can find this information by visiting the website dopomoha.ro and navigating to the page titled "National Curative Health Programs".

answers.answer:
Patients receive medical benefits including medicine, sanitary materials, medical devices, specific services (such as radiotherapy and dialysis), and specific investigations (like glycosylated hemoglobin dosage and PET-CT). For certain programs, such as the national program for replacement of renal function, non-medicalized transport and monthly transport of specific medicines and sanitary materials are also provided.

You can find this detailed information by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and reading under the "National Curative Health Programs" section.
answers.bResponse:

For certain programs, such as the national program for replacement of renal function, non-medicalized transport and monthly transport of specific medicines and sanitary materials are also provided.

You can find this detailed information by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and reading under the "National Curative Health Programs" section. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs

answers.answer:
Yes, National Curative Health Programs cover the cost of medicines and medical devices. Patients can benefit from these within the programs, with specific conditions applying to the types of medicines provided.

To find detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs` and read under the section "National Curative Health Programs".

answers.answer:
Medicines for patients enrolled in National Curative Health Programs can be dispensed through either community pharmacies (open-circuit) or hospital pharmacies (closed-circuit), with the specific pharmacy type depending on the patient's condition.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the section that discusses how medicines are granted under the PNSC, specifically the part about dispensing through community or hospital pharmacies.

answers.answer:
No, only those medicines included in the List of compensated medicines approved by Government Decision are covered, and only for conditions that are the subject of the National Curative Health Programs.

You can find this detailed information by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and reading under the section describing what is provided within the National Curative Health Programs (PNSC).

answers.answer:
To enroll in a National Curative Health Program, a patient must contact a specialist doctor working in a health unit that runs the respective program. The specialist doctor will then decide on enrollment based on the patient's condition, health state, and eligibility criteria.

You can find detailed information on how to enroll by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and reading the section titled "Enrollment of patients in a national curative health program."

answers.answer:
National Curative Health Programs address a wide range of conditions including cardiovascular diseases, oncology, deafness, diabetes, neurological diseases, hemophilia, thalassemia, rare diseases, mental health, endocrine diseases, orthopedic conditions, organ transplantation, chronic renal failure, and liver failure.

To find this detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and refer to the section titled "The national curative health programs run by CNAS are:".
answers.bResponse:

To find this detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and refer to the section titled "The national curative health programs run by CNAS are:". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs

answers.answer:
Yes, the National Curative Health Program for renal function replacement includes non-medicalized transport of hemodialysis patients from and to their homes, as well as monthly transport of medicines and sanitary materials for peritoneal dialysis patients.

To find this detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read under the section describing the "national program for replacement of renal function (dialysis) for patients with chronic renal failure".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, the National Curative Health Program for renal function replacement includes non-medicalized transport of hemodialysis patients from and to their homes, as well as monthly transport of medicines and sanitary materials for peritoneal dialysis patients.

To find this detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read under the section describing the "national program for replacement of renal function (dialysis) for patients with chronic renal failure". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs
